'White people shoot at us': Southern Brazil's Indigenous communities fight for ancestral land
subhead: In Mato Grosso do Sul, a southern state bordering Paraguay, Indigenous people who tried to reclaim the lands from which they had been dispossessed face violence from large landowners. The left-wing government largely remains powerless in the face of this tragedy.

EU further abandons its Green Deal with pledge to buy US energy
subhead: As part of the trade agreement between the European Union and the US, Europe committed to making strategic purchases across the Atlantic worth $750 billion (about €650 billion), covering fuels.

title: Trump announces new tariffs on Brazil, India, South Korea as deadline nears
subhead: The US president imposed crippling 50% tariffs on Brazil, a 25% levy on Indian exports and a 15% tariff for South Korean exports, while warning Canada it would face trade repercussions for planning to recognize a Palestinian state.

title: Gabriel Hagai, a mystic and political rabbi
subhead: Hagai, 57, has lived a thousand lives. A specialist in Hebrew manuscripts, the religious figure who embraces mystical Judaism has also been a baker in Boston, a researcher and, currently, a herbalist.

title: Dominique de Villepin: 'We have an absolute moral duty to oppose this murderous madness in Gaza'
subhead: The former French prime minister writes that to remain silent in the face of the horror unfolding in the Palestinian enclave is to be complicit, and that everyone has a duty to act and to name the crime taking place.

title: 'I learned freedom at 34, and it was a revelation': Katja Lange-Müller, an eastern wind blows through West Berlin
subhead: 'Being 20 in West Berlin' (3/6). Katja Lange-Müller, born in the German Democratic Republic (GDR), managed as an adult to cross 'to the other side' of the Wall, escaping her mother, a prominent member of the communist regime.

title: Economist Dmitry Nekrasov: 'Only a handful of sanctions have had a serious effect on Putin's ability to continue the war'
subhead: Nekrasov, a former Kremlin adviser who joined the opposition and now lives in exile, discusses the EU's latest package of sanctions against Russia and their potential effectiveness.

title: 'In the West Berlin squats, we argued but lived together': Karin Wieland, political rebel
subhead: 'Being 20 in West Berlin' (2/6). In the late 1970s, Karin Wieland fled her small German town to live communally in an abandoned building in Kreuzberg, throwing herself into every cause of the era.
